The base structure class to use for the behavior of the structure. (Like extra terrain checks and such)
Since we are using a custom structure class with its own codec, you'll notice there's no use_expansion_hack field
below like the minecraft:jigsaw structure type has. This is because our custom structure's codec does not have
that field because we should not need expansion hacks for our structures. It's only for legacy Minecraft villages.
the path to the template pool json file to use
If this field is present, the game will look for a downward facing Jigsaw Block with this Name field in the chosen start piece.
Once found, it will then spawn the start piece so that it's Jigsaw Block is now the true structure center position.
If this field is not present, the start piece will spawn where the structure's true scenter position is the corner of the starting piece.
This is how many pieces away from the starting piece a piece of the structure can spawn
Think of it like the length of the branch of the structure
Maximum distance away from center that pieces can spawn.
Horizontal cannot be bigger than 128 or else pieces gets cutoff. If terrain adaption is present and set to not `none`, max horizontal is 116.
Vertical is limited to the dimension's height. 258 is a good default.
The biome tag to use for what biomes that this structure can spawn in
The generation step for when to generate the structure. there are 10 stages you can pick from!
This surface structure stage places the structure before plants and ores are generated
See GenerationStep.Feature enum for all the stages you can use and what order they are in
Where to spawn our structure at what y value if project_start_to_heightmap is not present.
start_height can be used to spawn at a random y value by using an object such as `minecraft:uniform` type
If project_start_to_heightmap is present, the y value chosen in start_height will be added to the terrain's y value.
So a start height that gives -5 will sink the structure 5 blocks into the terrain.
Here, we will spawn this structure between 10 to 40 blocks above terrain surface.
This will prevent the structure from placing pieces within 5 blocks of world bottom OR within 5 blocks of world top.
Useful for a structure that is heightmap snapping, this padding will help prevent it from placing pieces on world bottom or world top easily.
Makes our structure take the terrain's top y value and add it to the start_height y value above.
The final value is the y value the structures spawn at.
WORLD_SURFACE_WG will stop at first non-air block so it spawns above oceans always instead of sunken into a deep sea.
What mobs can spawn over time in the structure.
Make sure you add the mob to the right category (monster, creature, etc)
